text:
e="preserve">The U.S. House Financial Services Subcommittee on Consumer Protection and Financial Institutions is a subcommittee of the House Committee on Financial Services.
Jurisdiction.
The subcommittee is in charge of overseeing all financial regulators, such as the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and the Federal Reserve. It is also in charge of all issues about consumer credit, including the Consumer Credit Protection Act, and access to financial services, as well as the safety of the banking system.
